name: Archwood Exchange & Buy Black Marketplace
address: 1401 E Van Buren St, Phoenix, AZ 85006
description: Archwood Exchange is a collective focused on supporting and showcasing Black-owned businesses in the greater Phoenix community. They host marketplaces and have a retail incubator
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: ACRES Retail Store (Archwood Community Resource Empowerment Strategy)
description: ACRES is an initiative by Archwood Exchange to empower the community by developing and supporting local small Black-owned businesses. It serves as a marketplace for over 30 local businesses
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: Afri-Soul Marketplace
description: Afri-Soul Marketplace is a home for community-minded business owners and a hub for cultural education, entrepreneurial development, and grassroots empowerment. It houses Archwood Exchange and other ventures
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: Grassrootz Bookstore and Juice Bar
description: Grassrootz Bookstore and Juice Bar offers books by Black authors, a juice bar, and a coworking space. It is also a participant in the Archwood Exchange marketplace
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: Straw and Wool
address: 610 E. Roosevelt St., Ste 144, Phoenix, AZ 85004
description: Straw and Wool is a business focused on headwear and accessories, and is a part of the Archwood Exchange collective
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: Chic Chef Co.
address: 2302 N. Central Ave., Ste. #3, Phoenix, AZ
description: Chic Chef Co. specializes in gourmet olive oils, specialty spice blends, and more. They also have a coffee shop concept called "The Grind by Chic Chef."
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: SugarJam The Southern Kitchen
description: SugarJam offers Southern brunch and features live music. It is owned and operated by Dana Dumas
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: Black Theatre Troupe
address: 1301 E. Washington St., Suite 101, Phoenix, AZ
description: The Black Theatre Troupe has been creating a space for Black-focused performances since the 1970s
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: The Peebles Corporation
description: While not exclusively in Arizona, The Peebles Corporation is a national real estate investment and development company founded by Don Peebles, specializing in large-scale residential, hospitality, retail, and mixed-use commercial properties. They focus on public-private partnerships and affirmative development
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation

name: Thinkzilla Consulting Group
address: Skysong 3, Arizona State University Innovation Center, 1365 N. Scottsdale Road, Suite 140, Scottsdale, AZ
description: Thinkzilla Consulting Group, led by Dr. Velma Trayham, spearheads initiatives like IMPACT AZ 2025, which supports Black-owned businesses in Arizona through a diversity readiness program
services: African-American-owned Marketplace development in Arizona consultation
